word:
Number of Meals. 
     381. The stomach must have careful attention. . . . After it has done its work for one meal, do not crowd more work upon it before it has had a chance to rest, and before a sufficient supply of gastric juice is provided. Five hours at least should be given between each meal, and always bear in mind that if you would give it a trial, you 
                                                                           84
would find two meals better than three.-- U. T., Aug. 30, 1896.
